## PathUtils.join() method

Joins multiple path segments and normalizes the result.

Behavior: - Concatenates segments with "/" and then runs `normalize`<!-- -->. - The returned path is always absolute.

Example: - join('/a', 'b', '../c') -<!-- -->&gt; '/a/c'

**Signature:**

```typescript
static join(...paths: string[]): string;
```

paths


</td><td>

string\[\]


</td><td>

Path segments in order.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string

Normalized absolute path.
